lines.text: Welcome to the library, young man. Don't tell me. You're here for a special book.
Stop stop stop. Allow me to guess. I have a talent for guessing what people need. You're in need of a fantasy! Brave knights, mythical fairies, ferocious dragons!
Adventure! Of course! You're a boy who loves adventure, brimming with wicked demons, cutthroat pirates.
Horror! Oh, horror! Evil demons, wicked monsters, haunted houses, graveyards. Yes, it's horror for you, boy. I'm sure of it. Your library card, please.

[pulls out a brand new one]
You do now. Sign here.
Richard Tyler, consider this your passport to the wonderful and quite unpredictable world of books.
But I don't want any books.
That's what I've been trying to tell you. I only came in here 'cause of the storm.
Hmm, you know what would make this a happy ending? A kiss.
[the screen goes blank, a smack is heard]
Quit it! We are in the presence of the Pagemaster.
I *know* who he is. He's the guy who did all THIS to me! Do you have any idea what I've been through?
I was nearly torn to shreds by a crazy doctor, I was made a slave to a bunch of mangy pirates, and eaten. Got that? Eaten by a fire-breathing dragon!
He don't mean it, my Pagemaster. He don't mean it.
Not to mention being tossed, squashed, and scared practically to death!
Think, boy. What kind of an adventure would you have had if I brought you here with the turn of a page?
I wrote the book on sailing. In fact, I *am* the book on sailing.
Sixteen men on a dead man's stomach...
How would you like to curl up with a good book?
Mercury levels in the tuna-fish sandwiches.

[to Adventure]
You guys are the only friends I ever had.
Remember, mate, not all sharks are in the water.

[reading the names on a house]
Dr. Jekyll, Mr. Hyde...
I come from a world of happy endings, why don't you come with us?
This is not good, definitely not good.
I'm a book, honey, I can read.
My boy, I derive no pleasure in telling you that you are in extreme danger.
Give the word, Captain Silver, and I'll show you the color of his insides.
Stow your cutlass, Tom, I want a better look at his outsides first.
Honey, that's what they all say.
Naturally. Who were you expecting, honey? The Tooth Fairy?
One gold piece! This is your treasure, is it. Let's kill him and eat his parrot.

[swiping Richard's library card]
A cabin boy don't need no library card.

[to Adventure]
I know I'm not your favorite kind of book, but I could be just like you.
You'll *never* be Adventure! You ain't got the spine for it!
Come on, honey, even books have spines!
Do I click my heels or something?
You're in the wrong story, honey.
What do you mean grabbing a person by the pantyhose like that? Now I've got to straighten out my Little Mermaid underwear.
Due to the storm, all lines have been temporarily disconnected. Please try your call again later.
